citation.article-title: Comparative chemotaxonomic and phylogenetic studies on the genus Arcanobacterium Collins et al. 1982 emend. Lehnen et al. 2006: proposal for Trueperella gen. nov. and emended description of the genus Arcanobacterium
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Trueperella bialowiezensis comb. nov.
Trueperella bialowiezensis (bi.a.lo.wi.e.zen′sis. N.L. fem. adj. bialowiezensis pertaining to Bialowieza, Poland, where the type strain was isolated).
Basonym: Arcanobacterium bialowiezense Lehnen et al. 2006.
The description is the same as given for Arcanobacterium bialowiezense Lehnen et al. (2006).
The species exhibits the characteristics listed in the description of the genus Trueperella.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan is of type A5α, variation l-Lys–l-Ala–l-Lys–d-Glu.
Cellular fatty acid composition is listed in Table 2.
Other phenotypic features are given in Table 4.
The type strain, 1(W3/01)T ( = DSM 17162T = NCTC 13354T), was isolated from the prepuce of a European bison.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.2 mol%.
